timeline.description: First company to take advantage of changes allowing Japanese patients to enter global phase 3 studies without bridging study. Included Japanese patients in PROSPERA study of seralutinib for pulmonary arterial hypertension.
Received Sakigake designation and orphan drug designation for tinlarebent (vision loss treatment). Benefits from streamlined registration process and potential price premiums.
Partnered with Viatris Japan to bring Nefecon (IgA nephropathy treatment) to market. Successfully acquired by Asahi Kasei for $1.1BN, demonstrating commercial validation.
Received PMDA clearance to include Japanese patients in global phase 3 trial of Clofazimine Inhalation Suspension for NTM lung disease, despite having no previous Japanese data.
